byline.contributor: Monica Davey reported from Chicago, and Richard Pérez-Peña from New York.
byline.original: By MONICA DAVEY and RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA

abstract: Independent Police Review Authority, agency that investigates conduct of Chicago police, releases video showing officers firing their guns at stolen car during chase that led to shooting death of Paul O'Neal, 18-year-old unarmed black man, in back; Sharon Fairley, chief administrator of agency, calls video shocking and disturbing.
lead_paragraph: Footage from dashboard and body cameras shows a police encounter with an unarmed man who had been riding in a car that was reported stolen, but it does not show the fatal shooting.
snippet: Footage from dashboard and body cameras shows a police encounter with an unarmed man who had been riding in a car that was reported stolen, but it does not show the fatal shooting....

headline.main: Chicago Releases Videos From Police Officers’ Killing of 18-Year-Old
headline.print_headline: Videos Released in Chicago From Fatal Police Shooting of Man, 18
